case_vignette: An 8-year-old boy is brought to the physician because he has excessively dry skin. His mother says that he has had dry, scaly skin since he was 6 months old. She says it is worse in winter and better in summer. There is no associated itching, redness, or discharge. Examination reveals generalized fine scales with coarse skin all over the body, except in the skin creases of the neck and in the cubital and popliteal fossae (see image). There are multiple papular elevations at the base of hair follicles and darkening of the palmar and plantar creases.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
My skin is really dry and scaly all over, and it gets worse in the winter.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've had dry, scaly skin since I was a baby, around 6 months old.
Do any of your immediate family members have similar skin issues?
The case vignette does not provide information regarding family members with similar skin issues.
Are there any areas of your skin that are more affected than others?
Yes, my skin is coarse and has fine scales all over, but not in the skin folds of my neck or the insides of my elbows and knees.
Have you been previously diagnosed with any skin conditions or other illnesses?
The case vignette does not mention any previous diagnoses for skin conditions or other illnesses.
Have you tried any treatments or moisturizers, and did they help?
The case vignette does not state whether I have tried any treatments or moisturizers.
Do you experience any itching or is there any redness associated with the dry, scaly skin?
No, there's no associated itching or redness.
Final Diagnosis: Ichthyosis vulgaris.

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A patient with dry, scaly skin all over, which worsens in the winter, presents to the dermatologist. The patient has experienced this since infancy, around 6 months old. The skin is coarse and has fine scales all over, but not in the skin folds of the neck or the insides of the elbows and knees. There is no mention of any previous diagnoses for skin conditions or other illnesses, and it is unclear whether the patient has tried any treatments or moisturizers. There is no associated itching or redness reported.
trial_0.vignette_frq: The most likely diagnosis is Ichthyosis vulgaris.
